p: Lu et al. from Wuhan Children’s Hospital reviewed the clinical features of 171 children who had confirmed COVID-19 infections. The median age was 6.7 years of age; 41.5% had a fever, 48.5% had coughing, and 46% pharyngeal erythema. Radiologically proven pneumonia was present in 111 (65%), but only 4 (2.3%) had hypoxemia with oxygen saturation <92%. Twelve children with radiologic pneumonia were asymptomatic [ 18]. Other less common reported symptoms in children include myalgia, sore throat, headache, and diarrhea. Coinfection with other pathogens was reported in 8 out of 20 (40%) children with confirmed COVID-19 and included influenza viruses A and B, Mycoplasma pneumoniae, respiratory syncytial virus, and cytomegalovirus [ 19].
